title: Days Century Growers Fruit Packing House

subtasks: Walking through the field

Operating the planting machine attached to the tractor
Adjusting the depth and spacing of seed placement
Checking seed quality and ensuring even distribution
Making necessary seed adjustments on the planting machine
Checking the water flow rate of the irrigator
Adjusting spouts to ensure even water distribution
Refilling the spraying solution in the sprayer
Mixing herbicides and pesticides in the sprayer tank
Filling oil and liquids for the combine harvester
Greasing and lubricating moving parts of the equipment
Cleaning the combine filters and sieve bars
Checking and replacing belts and hoses
Verifying the sharpness of sickle blades on the combine
Driving the tractor for various tasks around the farm
Guiding the planting machine as it seeds the field
Operating the irrigation system to water crops
Using the sprayer to apply herbicides or pesticides
Operating the combine harvester for harvesting crops
Dumping the harvested grain into the storage bin
Checking the moisture content of the grain in the combine
Loading the harvested grain onto trucks or into storage bins
Cleaning and handling the grain after delivery
Ensuring grain is properly stored to prevent spoilage

tasks.task: ** Adjusting farming activities based on weather
subtasks: Waiting for dry weather to plant or harvest crops
Covering crops with tarps during rain to prevent overwatering
Postponing spraying tasks if the weather is too windy or rainy
Loading the tractor with necessary equipment for field work
Driving the tractor to the field from the barn or storage area
Helping other farm workers to load and unload equipment onto the tractor
Operating the winch on the tractor for heavy lifting
Using the tow bar to pull the equipment if necessary
Guiding the grain wagon into position when the combine is harvesting
Handing the combine operator signals to empty the bin
Distributing the grain to different storage locations within the farm
Ensuring that grain bins are properly elevated for storage

tasks.task: ** Maintenance of grain bins and storage facilities
subtasks: Inspecting grain bins for leaks or damage after harvest
Cleaning the inside of the bins to prevent mold growth
Tidying the storage area to maintain order and accessibility
Covering the grain with tarp when storing to protect from moisture and pests
Guiding trucks into loading areas for picking up harvested grain
Ensuring proper loading techniques to avoid spills or loss
Checking the seals on transport containers to prevent leaks during transit
Escorting trucks to the next processing facility once loaded
Retrieving keys or passes needed for grain transport
Fixing a broken seed tube on the planting machine
Replacing a missing spout on the irrigator
Adjusting the sprayer’s droplet size for optimal coverage
Replacing a damaged fan belt on the combine
Checking the water pressure for the sprinkler system
Adjusting motor rotation to ensure proper spray pattern
Cleaning nozzle inserts on the irrigation pipes
Testing the efficacy of the irrigation coverage across the field
Driving a tractor attached to a disc harrow to break up soil
Checking the plow plane to ensure correct soil depth
Adjustingsharpening plow blades as needed
Preparing for planting by leveling the field
Checking bank accounts to track income and expenses
Budgeting for upcoming farming tasks such as fuel, seed, and equipment repairs
Notedown daily expenses for tax purposes
Calculating labor needs for field operations
Managing inventory of seeds, fertilizers, and other inputs
Scheduling deliveries of farm supplies
Scrubbing the combine after harvest to remove residual grain
Washing the tractor cab and exterior after field work
Disinfecting the sprayer to prevent clogs and contamination
Ensuring all equipment is clean before storage to avoid corrosion
Providing instructions to farmhands on planting procedures
Ensuring workers follow safety protocols when operating equipment
Allocating tasks among field workers based on their strengths
Knowing the location of first aid kits around the farm
Administering first aid to workers in case of accidents
Coordinating with emergency services if necessary

tasks.task: ** Conducting soil tests and analyzing crop health
subtasks: Collecting soil samples from different areas of the field
Sending soil samples to a lab for nutrient analysis
Checking for signs of pest infestations on crops
